example: The sea was calm. (大海很平静。)
She remained calm during the crisis. (她在危机中保持镇静。)
synsets: S: (adj) calm (not agitated; without losing self-possession)

example: Companies must innovate to survive. (公司必须创新才能生存。)
They are always looking for ways to innovate their products. (他们总是在寻找创新产品的方法。)
synsets: S: (v) innovate (create new things and ideas)

example: A benevolent dictator. (一位仁慈的独裁者。)
Her benevolent smile made everyone feel at ease. (她仁慈的微笑让每个人都感到放松。)
synsets: S: (adj) benevolent (showing or motivated by sympathy and understanding and generosity)

example: The resilience of nature. (大自然的恢复力。)
He showed great resilience in overcoming his illness. (他在克服疾病方面表现出极大的韧性。)
fillInTheBlankExamples: The community showed incredible ______ after the disaster. (灾难后社区展现出令人难以置信的恢复力。)
synsets: S: (n) resilience (the physical property of a material that can return to its original shape or position after being compressed or stretched or bent)

synonymReplacementExamples.originalSentence: The material's ability to spring back into shape is impressive.
synonymReplacementExamples.originalTranslation: 这种材料恢复原状的能力令人印象深刻。

definition: 普遍存在的，无处不在的
example: Mobile phones are now ubiquitous. (手机现在无处不在。)
The company's advertisements are ubiquitous. (这家公司的广告无处不在。)
synsets: S: (adj) ubiquitous (being present everywhere at once)

clozeTestExamples.clozeSentence: In today's digital age, smartphones have become truly ______.
clozeTestExamples.clozeSentenceTranslation: 在当今的数字时代，智能手机变得无处不在。

clozeTestExamples.clozeSentence: Coffee shops are ______ in this city; you can find one on almost every corner.
clozeTestExamples.clozeSentenceTranslation: 咖啡馆在这座城市无处不在；几乎每个角落都能找到一家。
